member.name: P:UniCanvas.CanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle
member.summary: Specifies the color, gradient, or pattern to use inside shapes. The default style is #000 (black).

member.name: M:UniCanvas.CanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern(UniCanvas.OffscreenCanvas,System.String)
member.param: "repeat", "repeat-x", "repeat-y", "no-repeat"

member.name: P:UniCanvas.CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineCap
member.summary: "butt", "round", "square"

member.name: P:UniCanvas.CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineJoin
member.summary: "bevel", "round", "miter"

member.name: P:UniCanvas.CanvasRenderingContext2D.textAlign
member.summary: "left", "right", "center", "start", "end"

member.name: P:UniCanvas.CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline
member.summary: "top", "hanging", "middle", "alphabetic", "ideographic", "bottom"

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.ch
member.summary: Relative to width of the "0" (zero)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.em
member.summary: Relative to the font-size of the element (2em means 2 times the size of the current font)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.ex
member.summary: Relative to the x-height of the current font

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.rem
member.summary: Relative to font-size of the root element

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.vh
member.summary: Relative to 1% of the height of the viewport

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.vw
member.summary: Relative to 1% of the width of the viewport

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.vmin
member.summary: Relative to 1% of viewport's smaller dimension

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.vmax
member.summary: Relative to 1% of viewport's larger dimension

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.px
member.summary: pixels (1px = 1/96th of 1in)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.cm
member.summary: centimeters

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.mm
member.summary: millimeters

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.in
member.summary: inches (1in = 96px = 2.54cm)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.pc
member.summary: picas (1pc = 12 pt)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Web.CSSLength.Type.pt
member.summary: points (1pt = 1/72 of 1in)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Repetition.Type.Repeat
member.summary: both directions

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Repetition.Type.RepeatX
member.summary: horizontal only

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Repetition.Type.RepeatY
member.summary: vertical only

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Repetition.Type.NoRepeat
member.summary: neither direction

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextAlign.Type.Left
member.summary: The text is left-aligned.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextAlign.Type.Right
member.summary: The text is right-aligned.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextAlign.Type.Center
member.summary: The text is centered.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextAlign.Type.Start
member.summary: The text is aligned at the normal start of the line (left-aligned for left-to-right locales, right-aligned for right-to-left locales).

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextAlign.Type.End
member.summary: The text is aligned at the normal end of the line (right-aligned for left-to-right locales, left-aligned for right-to-left locales).

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextBaseline.Type.Top
member.summary: The text baseline is the top of the em square.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextBaseline.Type.Hanging
member.summary: The text baseline is the hanging baseline. (Used by Tibetan and other Indic scripts.)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextBaseline.Type.Middle
member.summary: The text baseline is the middle of the em square.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextBaseline.Type.Alphabetic
member.summary: The text baseline is the normal alphabetic baseline. Default value.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextBaseline.Type.Ideographic
member.summary: The text baseline is the ideographic baseline; this is the bottom of the body of the characters, if the main body of characters protrudes beneath the alphabetic baseline. (Used by Chinese, Japanese, and Korean scripts.)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.TextBaseline.Type.Bottom
member.summary: The text baseline is the bottom of the bounding box. This differs from the ideographic baseline in that the ideographic baseline doesn't consider descenders.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias
member.summary: Specifies the type of antialiasing to do when rendering text or shapes. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias.Default
member.summary: Use the default antialiasing for the subsystem and target device, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias.None
member.summary: Use a bilevel alpha mask, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias.Gray
member.summary: Perform single-color antialiasing (using shades of gray for black text on a white background, for example), since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias.Subpixel
member.summary: Perform antialiasing by taking advantage of the order of subpixel elements on devices such as LCD panels, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias.Fast
member.summary: Hint that the backend should perform some antialiasing but prefer speed over quality, since 1.12

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias.Good
member.summary: The backend should balance quality against performance, since 1.12

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Antialias.Best
member.summary: Hint that the backend should render at the highest quality, sacrificing speed if necessary, since 1.12

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Content
member.summary: Content is used to describe the content that a surface will contain, whether color information, alpha information (translucence vs. opacity), or both. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Content.Color
member.summary: The surface will hold color content only. (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Content.Alpha
member.summary: The surface will hold alpha content only. (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Content.ColorAlpha
member.summary: The surface will hold color and alpha content. (Since 1.0)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType
member.summary: DeviceType is used to describe the type of a given device. The devices types are also known as "backends" within cairo. Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.DRM
member.summary: The device is of type Direct Render Manager, since 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.GL
member.summary: The device is of type OpenGL, since 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.Script
member.summary: The device is of type script, since 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.XCB
member.summary: The device is of type xcb, since 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.XLib
member.summary: The device is of type xlib, since 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.XML
member.summary: The device is of type XML, since 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.Cogl
member.summary: The device is of type cogl, since 1.12

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.Win32
member.summary: The device is of type win32, since 1.12

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.DeviceType.Invalid
member.summary: The device is invalid, since 1.10

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Extend
member.summary: Extend is used to describe how pattern color/alpha will be determined for areas "outside" the pattern's natural area, (for example, outside the surface bounds or outside the gradient geometry). Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Extend.None
member.summary: pixels outside of the source pattern are fully transparent (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Extend.Repeat
member.summary: the pattern is tiled by repeating (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Extend.Reflect
member.summary: the pattern is tiled by reflecting at the edges (Since 1.0; but only implemented for surface patterns since 1.6)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Extend.Pad
member.summary: pixels outside of the pattern copy the closest pixel from the source (Since 1.2; but only implemented for surface patterns since 1.6)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.FillRule
member.summary: FillRule is used to select how paths are filled. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FillRule.Winding
member.summary: If the path crosses the ray from left-to-right, counts +1. If the path crosses the ray from right to left, counts -1. (Left and right are determined from the perspective of looking along the ray from the starting point.) If the total count is non-zero, the point will be filled. (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Counts the total number of intersections, without regard to the orientation of the contour. If the total number of intersections is odd, the point will be filled. (Since 1.0)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Filter
member.summary: Filter is used to indicate what filtering should be applied when reading pixel values from patterns. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Filter.Fast
member.summary: A high-performance filter, with quality similar to Nearest (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Filter.Good
member.summary: A reasonable-performance filter, with quality similar to Bilinear (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Filter.Best
member.summary: The highest-quality available, performance may not be suitable for interactive use. (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Filter.Nearest
member.summary: Nearest-neighbor filtering (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Filter.Bilinear
member.summary: Linear interpolation in two dimensions (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Filter.Gaussian
member.summary: This filter value is currently unimplemented, and should not be used in current code. (Since 1.0)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontSlant
member.summary: Specifies variants of a font face based on their slant. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontSlant.Normal
member.summary: Upright font style, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontSlant.Italic
member.summary: Italic font style, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontSlant.Oblique
member.summary: Oblique font style, since 1.0

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontType
member.summary: FontType is used to describe the type of a given font face or scaled font. The font types are also known as "font backends" within cairo. Since: 1.2

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontType.Toy
member.summary: The font was created using cairo's toy font api (Since: 1.2)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontType.FT
member.summary: The font is of type FreeType (Since: 1.2)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontType.Win32
member.summary: The font is of type Win32 (Since: 1.2)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontType.Quartz
member.summary: The font is of type Quartz (Since: 1.6, in 1.2 and 1.4 it was named CAIRO_FONT_TYPE_ATSUI)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontType.User
member.summary: The font was create using cairo's user font api (Since: 1.8)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontWeight
member.summary: Specifies variants of a font face based on their weight. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontWeight.Normal
member.summary: Normal font weight, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontWeight.Bold
member.summary: Bold font weight, since 1.0

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format
member.summary: Format is used to identify the memory format of image data. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format.Invalid
member.summary: no such format exists or is supported.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format.ARGB32
member.summary: each pixel is a 32-bit quantity, with alpha in the upper 8 bits, then red, then green, then blue. The 32-bit quantities are stored native-endian. Pre-multiplied alpha is used. (That is, 50% transparent red is 0x80800000, not 0x80ff0000.) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format.RGB24
member.summary: each pixel is a 32-bit quantity, with the upper 8 bits unused. Red, Green, and Blue are stored in the remaining 24 bits in that order. (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format.A8
member.summary: each pixel is a 8-bit quantity holding an alpha value. (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format.A1
member.summary: each pixel is a 1-bit quantity holding an alpha value. Pixels are packed together into 32-bit quantities. The ordering of the bits matches the endianness of the platform. On a big-endian machine, the first pixel is in the uppermost bit, on a little-endian machine the first pixel is in the least-significant bit. (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format.RGB16_565
member.summary: each pixel is a 16-bit quantity with red in the upper 5 bits, then green in the middle 6 bits, and blue in the lower 5 bits. (Since 1.2)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Format.RGB30
member.summary: like RGB24 but with 10bpc. (Since 1.12)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.FTSynthesize
member.summary: A set of synthesis options to control how FreeType renders the glyphs for a particular font face. Since: 1.12

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FTSynthesize.Bold
member.summary: Embolden the glyphs (redraw with a pixel offset)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FTSynthesize.Oblique
member.summary: Slant the glyph outline by 12 degrees to the right.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintMetrics
member.summary: Specifies whether to hint font metrics. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintMetrics.Default
member.summary: Hint metrics in the default manner for the font backend and target device, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintMetrics.Off
member.summary: Do not hint font metrics, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintMetrics.On
member.summary: Hint font metrics, since 1.0

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintStyle
member.summary: Specifies the type of hinting to do on font outlines. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintStyle.Default
member.summary: Use the default hint style for font backend and target device, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintStyle.None
member.summary: Do not hint outlines, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintStyle.Slight
member.summary: Hint outlines slightly to improve contrast while retaining good fidelity to the original shapes, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintStyle.Medium
member.summary: Hint outlines with medium strength giving a compromise between fidelity to the original shapes and contrast, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.HintStyle.Full
member.summary: Hint outlines to maximize contrast, since 1.0

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineCap
member.summary: Specifies how to render the endpoints of the path when stroking. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineCap.Butt
member.summary: start(stop) the line exactly at the start(end) point (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineCap.Round
member.summary: use a round ending, the center of the circle is the end point (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineCap.Square
member.summary: use squared ending, the center of the square is the end point (Since 1.0)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineJoin
member.summary: Specifies how to render the junction of two lines when stroking. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineJoin.Miter
member.summary: use a sharp (angled) corner, see cairo_set_miter_limit() (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineJoin.Round
member.summary: use a rounded join, the center of the circle is the joint point (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.LineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: use a cut-off join, the join is cut off at half the line width from the joint point (Since 1.0)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator
member.summary: Operator is used to set the compositing operator for all cairo drawing operations. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Clear
member.summary: clear destination layer (bounded) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Source
member.summary: replace destination layer (bounded) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Over
member.summary: draw source layer on top of destination layer (bounded) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.In
member.summary: draw source where there was destination content (unbounded) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Out
member.summary: draw source where there was no destination content (unbounded) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Atop
member.summary: draw source on top of destination content and only there (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Dest
member.summary: ignore the source (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.DestOver
member.summary: draw destination on top of source (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.DestIn
member.summary: leave destination only where there was source content (unbounded) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.DestOut
member.summary: leave destination only where there was no source content (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.DestAtop
member.summary: leave destination on top of source content and only there (unbounded) (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Xor
member.summary: source and destination are shown where there is only one of them (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Add
member.summary: source and destination layers are accumulated (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Saturate
member.summary: like over, but assuming source and dest are disjoint geometries (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Multiply
member.summary: source and destination layers are multiplied. This causes the result to be at least as dark as the darker inputs. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Screen
member.summary: source and destination are complemented and multiplied. This causes the result to be at least as light as the lighter inputs. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Overlay
member.summary: multiplies or screens, depending on the lightness of the destination color. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Darken
member.summary: replaces the destination with the source if it is darker, otherwise keeps the source. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Lighten
member.summary: replaces the destination with the source if it is lighter, otherwise keeps the source. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.ColorDodge
member.summary: brightens the destination color to reflect the source color. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.ColorBurn
member.summary: darkens the destination color to reflect the source color. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens, dependent on source color. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens, dependent on source color. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Difference
member.summary: Takes the difference of the source and destination color. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to difference, but with lower contrast. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.HslHue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source and the saturation and luminosity of the target. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.HslSaturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source and the hue and luminosity of the target. Painting with this mode onto a gray area produces no change. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.HslColor
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source and the luminosity of the target. This preserves the gray levels of the target and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Operator.HslLuminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source and the hue and saturation of the target. This produces an inverse effect to HslColor. (Since 1.10)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.PathDataType
member.summary: PathDataType is used to describe the type of one portion of a path when represented as a Path. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PathDataType.MoveTo
member.summary: A move-to operation, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PathDataType.LineTo
member.summary: A line-to operation, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PathDataType.CurveTo
member.summary: A curve-to operation, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PathDataType.ClosePath
member.summary: A close-path operation, since 1.0

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.PatternType
member.summary: PatternType is used to describe the type of a given pattern. Since: 1.2

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PatternType.Solid
member.summary: The pattern is a solid (uniform) color. It may be opaque or translucent, since 1.2.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PatternType.Surface
member.summary: The pattern is a based on a surface (an image), since 1.2.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PatternType.Linear
member.summary: The pattern is a linear gradient, since 1.2.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PatternType.Radial
member.summary: The pattern is a radial gradient, since 1.2.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PatternType.Mesh
member.summary: The pattern is a mesh, since 1.12.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PatternType.RasterSource
member.summary: The pattern is a user pattern providing raster data, since 1.12.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata
member.summary: PDFMetadata is used by the cairo_pdf_surface_set_metadata() function specify the metadata to set. Since: 1.16

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata.Title
member.summary: The document title (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata.Author
member.summary: The document author (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata.Subject
member.summary: The document subject (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata.Keywords
member.summary: The document keywords (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata.Creator
member.summary: The document creator (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata.CreateDate
member.summary: The document creation date (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFMetadata.ModDate
member.summary: The document modification date (Since 1.16)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFOutlineFlags
member.summary: PDFOutlineFlags is used by the cairo_pdf_surface_add_outline() function specify the attributes of an outline item. These flags may be bitwise-or'd to produce any combination of flags. Since: 1.16

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFOutlineFlags.Open
member.summary: The outline item defaults to open in the PDF viewer (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFOutlineFlags.Bold
member.summary: The outline item is displayed by the viewer in bold text (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFOutlineFlags.Italic
member.summary: The outline item is displayed by the viewer in italic text (Since 1.16)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFVersion
member.summary: PDFVersion is used to describe the version number of the PDF specification that a generated PDF file will conform to. Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFVersion.Version_1_4
member.summary: The version 1.4 of the PDF specification. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PDFVersion.Version_1_5
member.summary: The version 1.5 of the PDF specification. (Since 1.10)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.PSLevel
member.summary: PSLevel is used to describe the language level of the PostScript Language Reference that a generated PostScript file will conform to. Since: 1.6

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PSLevel.Level2
member.summary: The language level 2 of the PostScript specification. (Since 1.6)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.PSLevel.Level3
member.summary: The language level 3 of the PostScript specification. (Since 1.6)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RegionOverlap
member.summary: Used as the return value for cairo_region_contains_rectangle(). Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RegionOverlap.In
member.summary: The contents are entirely inside the region. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RegionOverlap.Out
member.summary: The contents are entirely outside the region. (Since 1.10)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RegionOverlap.Part
member.summary: The contents are partially inside and partially outside the region. (Since 1.10)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.ScriptMode
member.summary: A set of script output variants. Since: 1.12

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.ScriptMode.Ascii
member.summary: the output will be in readable text (default). (Since 1.12)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.ScriptMode.Binary
member.summary: the output will use byte codes. (Since 1.12)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status
member.summary: CairoStatus is used to indicate errors that can occur when using Cairo. Since: 1.0
member.remarks: In some cases it is returned directly by functions. but when using cairo_t, the last error, if any, is stored in the context and can be retrieved with cairo_status().

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status.Success
member.summary: no error has occurred (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status.NoMemory
member.summary: out of memory (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status.InvalidRestore
member.summary: cairo_restore() called without matching cairo_save() (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status.InvalidPopGroup
member.summary: no saved group to pop, i.e. cairo_pop_group() without matching cairo_push_group() (Since 1.0)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status.NoCurrentPoint

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status.TagError

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Status.LastStatus
member.summary: this is a special value indicating the number of status values defined in this enumeration. When using this value, note that the version of cairo at run-time may have additional status values defined than the value of this symbol at compile-time. (Since 1.10)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.SubpixelOrder
member.summary: The subpixel order specifies the order of color elements within each pixel on the display device when rendering with an antialiasing mode of CAIRO_ANTIALIAS_SUBPIXEL. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SubpixelOrder.Default
member.summary: Use the default subpixel order for for the target device, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SubpixelOrder.RGB
member.summary: Subpixel elements are arranged horizontally with red at the left, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SubpixelOrder.BGR
member.summary: Subpixel elements are arranged horizontally with blue at the left, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SubpixelOrder.VRGB
member.summary: Subpixel elements are arranged vertically with red at the top, since 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SubpixelOrder.VBGR
member.summary: Subpixel elements are arranged vertically with blue at the top, since 1.0

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.SurfaceType

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit
member.summary: SVGUnit is used to describe the units valid for coordinates and lengths in the SVG specification. Since: 1.16

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.User
member.summary: User unit, a value in the current coordinate system. If used in the root element for the initial coordinate systems it corresponds to pixels. (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.EM
member.summary: The size of the element's font. (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.EX
member.summary: The x-height of the elements font. (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.PX
member.summary: Pixels (1px = 1/96th of 1in). (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.IN
member.summary: Inches (1in = 2.54cm = 96px). (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.CM
member.summary: Centimeters (1cm = 96px/2.54). (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.MM
member.summary: Millimeters (1mm = 1/10th of 1cm). (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.PT
member.summary: Points (1pt = 1/72th of 1in). (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.PC
member.summary: Picas (1pc = 1/6th of 1in). (Since 1.16)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGUnit.Percent
member.summary: Percent, a value that is some fraction of another reference value. (Since 1.16)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGVersion
member.summary: cairo_svg_version_t is used to describe the version number of the SVG specification that a generated SVG file will conform to. Since: 1.2

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGVersion.Version_1_1
member.summary: The version 1.1 of the SVG specification. (Since 1.2)

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.SVGVersion.Version_1_2
member.summary: The version 1.2 of the SVG specification. (Since 1.2)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextClusterFlags
member.summary: Specifies properties of a text cluster mapping. Since: 1.8

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextClusterFlags.Backward
member.summary: The clusters in the cluster array map to glyphs in the glyph array from end to start. (Since 1.8)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.CairoMatrix
member.summary: A Matrix holds an affine transformation, such as a scale, rotation, shear, or a combination of those. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.CairoMatrix.xx
member.summary: xx component of the affine transformation

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.CairoMatrix.yx
member.summary: yx component of the affine transformation

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.CairoMatrix.xy
member.summary: xy component of the affine transformation

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.CairoMatrix.yy
member.summary: yy component of the affine transformation

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.CairoMatrix.x0
member.summary: X translation component of the affine transformation

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.CairoMatrix.y0
member.summary: Y translation component of the affine transformation

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontExtents
member.summary: The FontExtents structure stores metric information for a font. Values are given in the current user-space coordinate system. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontExtents.ascent
member.summary: the distance that the font extends above the baseline. Note that this is not always exactly equal to the maximum of the extents of all the glyphs in the font, but rather is picked to express the font designer's intent as to how the font should align with elements above it.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontExtents.descent
member.summary: the distance that the font extends below the baseline. This value is positive for typical fonts that include portions below the baseline. Note that this is not always exactly equal to the maximum of the extents of all the glyphs in the font, but rather is picked to express the font designer's intent as to how the font should align with elements below it.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontExtents.height
member.summary: the recommended vertical distance between baselines when setting consecutive lines of text with the font. This is greater than ascent +descent by a quantity known as the line spacing or external leading. When space is at a premium, most fonts can be set with only a distance of ascent +descent between lines.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontExtents.maxXAdvance
member.summary: the maximum distance in the X direction that the origin is advanced for any glyph in the font.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.FontExtents.maxYAdvance
member.summary: the maximum distance in the Y direction that the origin is advanced for any glyph in the font. This will be zero for normal fonts used for horizontal writing. (The scripts of East Asia are sometimes written vertically.)

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Glyph
member.summary: The Glyph structure holds information about a single glyph when drawing or measuring text. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Glyph.index
member.summary: glyph index in the font. The exact interpretation of the glyph index depends on the font technology being used.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Glyph.x
member.summary: the offset in the X direction between the origin used for drawing or measuring the string and the origin of this glyph.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Glyph.y
member.summary: the offset in the Y direction between the origin used for drawing or measuring the string and the origin of this glyph.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Path
member.summary: A data structure for holding a path. This data structure serves as the return value for cairo_copy_path() and cairo_copy_path_flat() as well the input value for cairo_append_path(). Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Path.status
member.summary: the current error status

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Path.data
member.summary: the elements in the path

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Path.numData
member.summary: the number of elements in the data array

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.PathData
member.summary: PathData is used to represent the path data inside a Path. Since: 1.0

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.Rectangle
member.summary: A data structure for holding a rectangle. Since: 1.4

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Rectangle.x
member.summary: X coordinate of the left side of the rectangle

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Rectangle.y
member.summary: Y coordinate of the the top side of the rectangle

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Rectangle.width
member.summary: width of the rectangle

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.Rectangle.height
member.summary: height of the rectangle

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleInt
member.summary: A data structure for holding a rectangle with integer coordinates. Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleInt.x
member.summary: X coordinate of the left side of the rectangle

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleInt.y
member.summary: Y coordinate of the the top side of the rectangle

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleInt.width
member.summary: width of the rectangle

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleInt.height
member.summary: height of the rectangle

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleList
member.summary: A data structure for holding a dynamically allocated array of rectangles. Since: 1.4

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleList.status
member.summary: Error status of the rectangle list

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleList.rectangles
member.summary: Array containing the rectangles

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.RectangleList.numRectangles
member.summary: Number of rectangles in this list

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextCluster
member.summary: The TextCluster structure holds information about a single text cluster. Since: 1.8

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextCluster.numBytes
member.summary: the number of bytes of UTF-8 text covered by cluster

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextCluster.numGlyphs
member.summary: the number of glyphs covered by cluster

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextExtents
member.summary: The cairo_text_extents_t structure stores the extents of a single glyph or a string of glyphs in user-space coordinates. Since: 1.0

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextExtents.xBearing
member.summary: the horizontal distance from the origin to the leftmost part of the glyphs as drawn. Positive if the glyphs lie entirely to the right of the origin.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextExtents.yBearing
member.summary: the vertical distance from the origin to the topmost part of the glyphs as drawn. Positive only if the glyphs lie completely below the origin; will usually be negative.

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextExtents.width
member.summary: width of the glyphs as drawn

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextExtents.height
member.summary: height of the glyphs as drawn

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextExtents.xAdvance
member.summary: distance to advance in the X direction after drawing these glyphs

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.TextExtents.yAdvance
member.summary: distance to advance in the Y direction after drawing these glyphs. Will typically be zero except for vertical text layout as found in East-Asian languages.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.DestroyFunc
member.summary: DestroyFunc the type of function which is called when a data element is destroyed. It is passed the pointer to the data element and should free any memory and resources allocated for it. Since: 1.0
member.param: The data element being destroyed.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.WriteFunc
member.summary: WriteFunc is the type of function which is called when a backend needs to write data to an output stream. Since: 1.0
member.param: the output closure
the buffer containing the data to write
the amount of data to write
member.returns: the status code of the write operation

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.ReadFunc
member.summary: ReadFunc is the type of function which is called when a backend needs to read data from an input stream. Since: 1.0
member.param: the input closure
the buffer into which to read the data
the amount of data to read
member.returns: the status code of the read operation

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RasterSourceAcquireFunc
member.summary: RasterSourceAcquireFunc is the type of function which is called when a pattern is being rendered from. Since: 1.12
member.param: the pattern being rendered from
the user data supplied during creation
the rendering target surface
rectangular region of interest in pixels in sample space

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RasterSourceReleaseFunc
member.summary: RasterSourceReleaseFunc is the type of function which is called when the pixel data is no longer being access by the pattern for the rendering operation. Typically this function will simply destroy the surface created during acquire. Since: 1.12
member.param: the pattern being rendered from
the user data supplied during creation
the surface created during acquire

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RasterSourceSnapshotFunc
member.summary: RasterSourceSnapshotFunc is the type of function which is called when the pixel data needs to be preserved for later use during printing. This pattern will be accessed again later, and it is expected to provide the pixel data that was current at the time of snapshotting. Since: 1.12
member.param: the pattern being rendered from
the user data supplied during creation
member.returns: CAIRO_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, or one of the cairo_status_t error codes for failure.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RasterSourceCopyFunc
member.summary: RasterSourceCopyFunc is the type of function which is called when the pattern gets copied as a normal part of rendering. Since: 1.12
member.param: the cairo_pattern_t that was copied to
the user data supplied during creation
the cairo_pattern_t being used as the source for the copy
member.returns: CAIRO_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, or one of the cairo_status_t error codes for failure.

member.name: T:UniCanvas.Cairo.RasterSourceFinishFunc
member.summary: RasterSourceFinishFunc is the type of function which is called when the pattern (or a copy thereof) is no longer required. Since: 1.12
member.param: the pattern being rendered from
the user data supplied during creation

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.CCITT_FAX
member.summary: Group 3 or Group 4 CCITT facsimile encoding (International Telecommunication Union, Recommendations T.4 and T.6.) Since: 1.16

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.CCITT_FAX_PARAMS
member.summary: Decode parameters for Group 3 or Group 4 CCITT facsimile encoding. See CCITT Fax Images. Since: 1.16

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.EPS
member.summary: Encapsulated PostScript file. Since: 1.16

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.EPS_PARAMS
member.summary: Embedding parameters Encapsulated PostScript data. Since: 1.16

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.JBIG2
member.summary: Joint Bi-level Image Experts Group image coding standard (ISO/IEC 11544). Since: 1.14

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.JBIG2_GLOBAL
member.summary: Joint Bi-level Image Experts Group image coding standard (ISO/IEC 11544) global segment. Since: 1.14

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.JBIG2_GLOBAL_ID
member.summary: An unique identifier shared by a JBIG2 global segment and all JBIG2 images that depend on the global segment. Since: 1.14

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.JP2
member.summary: The Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) 2000 image coding standard (ISO/IEC 15444-1). Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.JPEG
member.summary: The Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) image coding standard (ISO/IEC 10918-1). Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.PNG
member.summary: The Portable Network Graphics image file format (ISO/IEC 15948). Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.URI
member.summary: URI for an image file (unofficial MIME type). Since: 1.10

member.name: F:UniCanvas.Cairo.MimeType.UNIQUE_ID
member.summary: Unique identifier for a surface (cairo specific MIME type). All surfaces with the same unique identifier will only be embedded once. Since: 1.12
